myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cont_function, function, Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Boaz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Monom> polynom
      the data structure used in this class to represent the Monom list is the ArrayList

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polynom()
      empty constructor which only allocates LinkedList type memory to the Polynom pointer
      Polynom(java.lang.String str)
      a constructor which input is a String, this method creates a new Polynom which values determined by the String input NOTE: this constructor works only on "ax^b+/-...." type of expression, where a is a double type variable, and b is a NON NEGATIVE integer,this constructor WILL NOT work for any non logically correct string other then the empty one, in this case this constructor will create a zero value Polynom, for more information please check the "readMe" file

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Monom m1)
      sums a Polynom and a Monom, actually it changes the Polynom which the method is used on to the values of the sum
      void add(Polynom_able p1)
      sums two Polynoms, actually it changes the Polynom which the method is used on to the values of the sum
      double area(double x0, double x1, double eps)
      calculates the area above x-axis of a polynom in a certain given borders, to the right of x0 and to the left of x1 as asked, using the numeric method of splitting the area to eps based rectangle and summing their surface NOTE:if (x0>x1) ===> the method will swap them NOTE2:this method will ignore rectangles for which f(x0)<0 or f(x1)<0, as this method calculates only the area above x-axis
      Polynom_able copy()
      creates a deep copy of the Polynom on which been used on
      Polynom_able derivative()
      returns the derivative of the Polynom on which was used on
      boolean equals(Polynom_able p1)
      checks whether two Polynoms are logically equal
      double f(double x)
      calculates Polynoms y value for a certain given x
      private void fixUp()
      Helping method which is used to remove zero value Monoms from the list
      private static Polynom initStringPolynom(java.lang.String str)
      private static method which supports Polynom String constructor
      boolean isZero()
      checks whether given Polynom is the zero Polynom
      java.util.Iterator<Monom> iteretor()
      sets up a basic iterator for the Polynom class
      void multiply(Polynom_able p1)
      Multiples two Monoms,actually it changes the Polynom which the method is used on to the values of the product
      double root(double x0, double x1, double eps)
      returns the root of given Polynom in a given range (to the left of x0 and to the right of x1) using Bisection method NOTE: if (x0>=x1)===> this will throw an exception as logically the method CANT HANDLE such a range
      void substract(Polynom_able p1)
      subtract one Polynom from the other
      private void subtract(Monom m1)
      helping private method which subtract one Monom from the Polynom, this method is created to support the subtract between Polynoms which we had to implement from the interface
      java.lang.String toString()
      toString method which used to print the value of the Polynom which is used on

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        returns the root of given Polynom in a given range (to the left of x0 and to the right of x1) using Bisection method NOTE: if (x0>=x1)===> this will throw an exception as logically the method CANT HANDLE such a range
        Specified by:
        root in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - double type variable, the start of the range in which the root should be found
        x1 - double type variable, the end of the range in which the root should be found
        eps - double type variable, the amount of deviation allowed,ASSUMED to be 0.01 or smaller, PLEASE NOTICE that a large eps will return not accurate area
        Returns:
        the double value of the point on the x axis which returns zero y NOTE: Took the algorithm from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bisection_method

        public Polynom_able copy()
        creates a deep copy of the Polynom on which been used on

        copy in interface Polynom_able
        Returns:
        a Polynom_able type object which is a deep copy of the Polynom the method was used on

      • area

        public double area(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        calculates the area above x-axis of a polynom in a certain given borders, to the right of x0 and to the left of x1 as asked, using the numeric method of splitting the area to eps based rectangle and summing their surface NOTE:if (x0>x1) ===> the method will swap them NOTE2:this method will ignore rectangles for which f(x0)<0 or f(x1)<0, as this method calculates only the area above x-axis
        Specified by:
        area in interface cont_function
        Specified by:
        area in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - double type variable, the start of the range in which we calculate the area above x - axis
        x1 - double type variable, the end of the range in which we calculate the area above x - axis
        eps - double type variable, the base of the rectangle calculated, ASSUMED to be 0.01 or smaller, PLEASE NOTICE that a large eps will return not accurate area
        Returns:
        the approximate area above the x axis under the Polynom function

      • initStringPolynom

        private static Polynom initStringPolynom(java.lang.String str)
        private static method which supports Polynom String constructor
        Parameters:
        str - String type variable which represents the soon to be Polynom
        Returns:
        a new ArrayList type object which will be used in the String constructor

      • subtract

        private void subtract(Monom m1)
        helping private method which subtract one Monom from the Polynom, this method is created to support the subtract between Polynoms which we had to implement from the interface
        Parameters:
        m1 - Monom type object which should be subtracted from the Polynom the method is used on
